fields.summary: When importing a word document, SEQ fields are converted into plain text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39145].
  {panel}

1. Create a document in MS Word which includes a \{TOC\}\\
2. Import the document into Confluence\\
3. Go to the newly-created Confluence page and either "Edit in Word" or "Export to Word"

The dynamic \{TOC\} has been converted to a list of static \{HYPERLINK\}s

This means that the TOC will no longer update when the document is updated.

It would be better to convert the Word \{TOC\} field to a Confluence \{TOC\} macro.
fields.summary: Import converts Word TOC to list of hyperlinks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39144].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Create two files, test.doc and test.docx
# Upload doc file into Confluence using Firefox 5 and click Edit in Word once it's uploaded.
# Install the Add-On and OpenOffice will open, authenticate you, and show the file.
# Make a change and save; the change will be saved to the file in WebDAV and the change can be seen using View File.
# Repeat steps 2-4; this time, when you save the file, the normal dialog for saving to your local filesystem will appear.

The same behavior occurs when using xls and xlsx files.  The XML formats fail to save back to Confluence.
fields.summary: Cannot save xlsx or docx files to WebDAV when using OpenOffice

fields.summary: Excel extactor causes OOME on studio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39131].
  {panel}

See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24965 - chose the wrong project

Importing Word (97 - 2003 *.DOC) Documents, created with Word 2007, works fine except for two things: Certain images look crappy, screenshots are rendered useless. This seems to happen for two things : 
a) Images are down scaled. This make them lose quality and, in some cases, make them unintelligible.
b) Not-PNG/JPG/GIF Images
See an example word doc and a resulting import. This makes the DOC-import for the majority of our documentation almost worthless. (See screenshot, which shows a very "well gone" import. There are images in our docs, who look TONS worse.
fields.summary: Import messes up graphics, renders them useless
When importing a word document, header order is not respected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39128].
  {panel}

# create a word document with an image
# embed this document on a confluence page
## the image is visible when browsing the page
# export the confluence page (either word or pdf)
## the image is _not_ visible in the export

there is a related issue CONF-25599 concerning _only word_ exports.
Thus I assumed pdf export should actually work, but it does not.
Images generated by other plugins, like e.g. gliffy, are at least visible on the pdf exports (although word is not working either).

I also tried to include the image directly into the page (i.e. without wrapping it into a word document). In this case it is indeed visible on the pdf-export.

I attached a test document as well.
fields.summary: when a page with an embedded office document with images is exported, the images are missing in the export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39127].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Background colour in table cell lost when importing/copying tables over from Word

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download [^saved.docx]
# On a Confluence page go to *... -> Import from Word*
# Import the document

OR

# Edit the page
# Copy the tables onto the page

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
Only the tables and text (+ text color) are saved in Confluence.
 
h3. Notes
On the .docx file - the first table was generated in Word, the other tables were created in Confluence.

Although the background color is lost, the font color is not.

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround
fields.summary: Background colour in table cell lost when importing from Word

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39118]. {panel} {viewfile} macro is no longer available from the list of available macros and existing viewfile macro can't be edited/updated. Also, for existing {viewfile} macro, in an Edit mode, when you choose the attachment it says: "(Not found)" and do not show the list of attachments from the specific page. See screen shot: !screen_01.png! h5. Workaround: Download and install [Confluence Source Editor plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor] through UPM. Next, go to the page which has the {viewfile} macro, edit the page, on the editor you'll see this [<>] button in between 'binocular' button and the [?] button, click on it and a window will pop-up and you'll get something like this: {code}

Book1.xlsx

{code} You may edit this specific line: {code} {code} to {code} {code} and then click 'Apply'. This should transform the {viewfile} macro to {viewxls}. However, I'm afraid this still has to be done manually on each affected {viewfile} macro. OR you can also insert {viewxls} macro into Confluence page using Insert > Wiki Markup. The file will be displayed fine in Confluence page but still can't be successfully edited/updated. {viewxls}, {viewdoc}, {viewppt} macros are working as expected.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39115].
  {panel}

The ability to use the "Edit Document" button within the viewfile macro is based on page permissions rather than attachment permissions.

If a user has permission to add pages within a space but not to add attachments, they will be able to edit an attachment that's displayed using the viewfile macro.

If a user doesn't have permission to add pages, but has permission to add attachments, they will not be able to edit and attachment that's displayed using the viewfile macro, although they could download the file and replace it.

The current behavior is inconsistent and confusing.  It would be less confusing if the "add attachment" permission were renamed to "add/edit", and if the Office Connector allowed edits based on that permission instead of page permissions.
fields.summary: "Edit Document" permissions for viewfile macro are based on page permissions rather than attachment permissions...

I have a page with an included Excel file.
* open the file with "Edit in office" in Excel 2013.

So, I have to paste the links, save the file, edit it again and extend every hyperlink with the contextPath /confluence. That's quite annoying.

Can you fix the relative path?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39099].
  {panel}

h3.Problem
The "Edit Document" button sends the full URL of the attached Office document to Excel (or Word or PowerPoint), which can not open the URL because it is too long.

h3.Fix
Unfortunately there is none yet.

h3.Workaround
As a workaround, I was able to access the document by moving it up the page hierarchy and access it using the page parameter of viewfile.

While this is likely a WebDav or Office issue, it could possibly be resolved by using a tiny URL, rather than sending the entire URL to the Office application.

h3.notes
I noticed that other users have experienced the issue as well (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/View+File+Macro?focusedCommentId=187859664#comment-187859664), but I did not find a matching issue. I replied in the forum with my workaround.

(All info was provided by Daniel)

When trying to import a Word document into Confluence that contains custom bullet points added to MS Word, you may encounter this exception:

{code}
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 1, Size: 1
	at java.util.ArrayList.RangeCheck(ArrayList.java:547)
	at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:322)
	at com.aspose.words.kd.dy(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.List.aF(Unknown Source)

	at com.aspose.words.Body.accept(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.CompositeNode.acceptChildren(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.Section.accept(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.CompositeNode.acceptChildren(Unknown Source)
{code}

I have attached an example file that just contains bullet points that should trigger the exception.

h3. Workaround
# Select all of the text in your document.
# Go to Format >> Bullets and Numbering...
# Choose one of the default bullet or numbering types that ships with MS Word.
# Save the document and attempt a new import into Confluence.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39081].
  {panel}

When opening a document in Confluence with a # in the title, a 500 error is thrown by the browser/editor.  In the logs this is seen as a null pointer exception due to the '#' being translated to %23.

The following is found in atlassian-confluence.logs
{code}
2012-01-17 09:29:14,527 ERROR [http-1413-4] [ContainerBase.[Standalone].[localhost].[/]] log Unhandled exception occurred whilst decorating page
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/confluence/editinword/589828/attachments/test%20 | userName: admin
java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

There is a lot more to the total stack trace but that is the start, I have attached a text file containing the entire trace.  It looks as though Confluence attempts to open the document multiple times before giving up.

It may also be worth noting this affects office connector 1.18 in Confluence 3.5.13 as well but 1.18 was not available in the affected versions lists.

*To Reproduce*
* Create document with '#' in title
* Attach to a page in Confluence
* Click 'edit in office' for the document you have uploaded
* Observe error

A single backslash "\" character in Excel sheet is not showing in ViewExcel. Two or three backslashes are shown as only one backslash in ViewExcel. Four backlashes are shown as two backslashes in ViewExcel

Reproducible in 2.0.14 and 2.0.15. *NOT* reproducible in Office Connector 2.1.4 and 2.1.7.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Attach [^test.xlsx] into a page
# Insert a View Excel macro and choose the attached page
The Excel should be shown as:
!screenshot.jpg!
Instead, it's showing as:
!screenshot2.jpg!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39052].
  {panel}

Have just started to play with the Roadmap Planner macro and have found an issue that I'm not sure whether it is a bug with this functionality or unrelated (also not sure whether it is a known issue), but have found that the accuracy of the placement of markers is almost an inch off between edit and save modes while in weeks mode.  

ie:
- Added a marker for 5th October
- Shows up as 28th Sep in preview/saved mode
- Edit the macro and change the marker to ~25th October and save
- Shows up as 5th Oct

Note: The same applies to bars created and moved manually, ie: bars initially created appear fine, but once moved off the starting line they appear to fall in to the same issue.
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner Macro - Marker (and Bar) accuracy incorrect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39048].
  {panel}

*Background*
Users want to track the status of his task, per page.
There are some macros on Confluence. However, these macros are inconvenient for tracking the status of task

|Task Macro|It is just for one status change.|
|Starus Macro|It cannot be edited from viewpage.|
|Label|Users need to type the exact label name.| 

*Request* 
Add the Radio Button function to Confluence.

*Expected Result*
Users can make single choice from selection list, from viewpage.
fields.summary: Radio Button for making single choice from viewpage, easily.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39043].
  {panel}

There are multiple places in Confluence code (although not so many!) where direct access to {{window.parent}} and {{window.top}} is made. This breaks violently when Confluence is run inside IFRAME and the parent frames are in another domain.

We need to show Confluence page inside a JIRA plugin to bring Confluence pages and JIRA issues together on one screen. 

I hope it won't be too much problem to fix this in the future. 

Thanks
Igor
fields.summary: Make Confluence be able to run inside IFRAME

h3. Summary
Content by Label Macro can only be updated once, if you update the Macro twice the _Save_ button is grayed out. 

Affected Version: 5.9.1-OD-2015.36.1-0001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create _How-to-article page_ 
# Edit the _Content Label Macro_, add _Of type_:Pagel; Click _Save_
# Edit the Macro again: _Of type is empty and the Save button is grayed out

h3. Expected Results
Ability to edit the _Content by Label Macro_ more than once without saving the entire page

h3. Actual Results
Unable to edit the _Content Label Macro_ more than once

h3. Notes
If you edit the _Content by label_ macro twice, you won't be able to add any other macro

h3.Workaround
Cancel updates on the macro, save the page and edit the macro again.
fields.summary: Content by label macro cannot be updated more than once
Comments should allow save/submission via Ctrl+Enter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39028].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
As Confluence page names must be unique within a space, the _Import Word Document_ in Confluence would fail should there are duplicate headings exist in that Word document file, given the _Split by heading_ option is chosen.


h5. Suggested Solution
To implement a feature that will automatically handle this error by adding padding to those duplicates headings.


h6. Workaround
Remove any duplicate headings before importing the affected Word document
fields.summary: Add Padding on Duplicate Headings for Import Word Document Feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39027].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
As of now, should an error occurred while trying to import a Word document by using the _Import Word Document_ feature in Confluence, the generic _Oops - an error has occurred_ will then be shown in the Confluence UI.


h5. Suggested Solution
As there are a couple of known bugs on this (Please refer to _Issue Links_ section). It would be better if an error handling is implemented to give more details to the user on what's causing the error.
fields.summary: Implement Error Handling on Failed to Import Word Document

h3. Summary
Default settings for the [Page Properties Report Macro | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Properties+Report+Macro] is 30 results if this is extended when exporting to Word or PDF document option is selected only the first 30 results are displayed.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# set *Number of items to display* in advance options to >30 (exe: 31)
# Select Export to Word or PDF

All results are displayed in exported document

h3. Actual Results
Only the first 30 item results are displayed
Same results if using the Page Export options in Space Tools > Content Tools

h3.Workaround
No workaround is available
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro Export to Word or PDF only displays 30 results

*Background of the request*
When editing in 5.4 , the text "Draft autosaved at hh:mm (view change)" used to be shown at the bottom of the window, and when you clicked on "view change" it did what it says.

In 5.8 Edit mode, this has moved to the formatting bar and no longer says "view change" - but if you click on the text you get the view change dialog as before.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38988].
  {panel}

It seems that the icons in Confluence are currently rendered using fontset. This can be an issue for organization especially banks that have strict security constraint (fontset cannot be downloaded) as a result this will not render on customer instance. 

I would recommend that we change the current method of icons being rendered using fontset being changed to HTML entities instead.

There is also a security issue which have been reported by Microsoft recently the link can be found below :
https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/kb/3079904

You can see an example of a customer instance not rendering the fontset icons as per the screenshot attached below :
!fontset not rendering.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: change fontset 'icons' to html entities to improve security compliance

h1. Steps To Reproduce
# Create a new Confluence space (i.e. Example).
# Create a new page (i.e. Sample Page).
# Insert some contents, *highlight some texts* and *link* it to a Confluence page via '*+*' sign > *Link*.
# Export the Confluence space (i.e. Example) to *XML* format.
# Import the XML backup to a Confluence instance and check the _atlassian-confluence.log_ file.

(i) Please refer to [^StepsToReproduce.mp4] screen cast for visual information. You may use [^Example-Space.zip] to reproduce the problem.

h1. Expected Behaviour
Space import complete without errors.

h1. Actual Behaviour
Space import complete with the following warnings thrown in the _atlassian-confluence.log_ file.
{code}
2015-09-01 17:18:37,653 WARN [Long running task: Importing data] [importexport.xmlimport.persister.XHtmlBodyContentPropertyUserRewriter] translateBodyContentXhtmlProperty Unable to parse text of BodyContent 2359299 as XHTML storage format: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 475. Parser message: Unexpected EOF in CDATA section

 -- referer: http://localhost:9581/confluence/admin/backup.action | url: /confluence/admin/restore.action | userName: admin | action: restore
2015-09-01 17:18:37,654 WARN [Long running task: Importing data] [importexport.xmlimport.persister.XHtmlBodyContentPropertyUserRewriter] translateBodyContentXhtmlProperty Unable to parse text of BodyContent 2359300 as XHTML storage format: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 497. Parser message: Unexpected EOF in CDATA section
 at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,497]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38977].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Attach a movie to a page.
# Insert a multimedia macro, showing your uploaded attachment. Ensure that autostart is unchecked.
# Save the page. The video will autoplay even though you left autostart unchecked.

Example page: https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2549712527

Workaround:

a) Insert the video using the new Files Previewer (just press Insert from the attachments page).

b) If that doesn't work (the Files Previewer notably doesn't support mp4s), you can use the following snippit in a HTML macro:

{code:html}
<video controls src="/download/attachments/pageId/attachmentName" width=1000 height=650>
{code}

* pageId can be found in the URL bar when you edit the page
* attachmentName is just the name of the file you uploaded
fields.summary: Multimedia macro always autoplays, regardless of the macro option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38976].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Anchors located in the automated numbering column in confluence tables are not preserved when additional rows are added.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table in Confluence Cloud
# Use the *Table Settings* to turn on 'Insert Numbering Column'
# Drag an Anchor into the Numbering Column
# Save the page and test you can link to the numbering column
# Edit the page and add a new row to the table

h3. Result
The Anchor in the Numbering Column disappears. 

h3. Suggested Solution
There are two options:
* Don't allow Anchors to be added to the automated numbering column; or
* Preserve the Anchor in the automated numbering column

h3. Workaround 
Place the Anchor in another column on the same row
fields.summary: Anchors and changes to automated numbering column in confluence tables are not preserved when additional rows are added
